name: Courtyard by Marriott Arlington Rosslyn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Marriott Rosslyn over Labor Day. While you are a bit of a drive from downtown DC, the easy access to the metro and the proximity of the Key Bridge and the Whitehurst Freeway make it easy to access Georgetown and the northwest areas. We got a great weekend deal--$99 room including parking and breakfast. We would stay here again
reviews.title: Good alternative to DC hotels

likes.liked: — I had a really nice view of the city from my room.
likes.disliked: — The slow-draining tub, the intermittent internet access.

reviews.text: I spent several days comparing hotel locations around the Washington, DC area including DC. We were looking at rates, amenities, convenience, reviews, and overall needs for our trip. I believe we got the most for our money. We were able to get the summer special which included free breakfast buffet for up to two adults, children were free. The hotel is about two blocks from the metro station. This was our first stay outside of DC and our first trip using the Metro. We found it all very easy to navigate. The hotel provided a book of helpful information. The restaurant at the hotel is breakfast only. This was not a problem for us. It met our needs perfectly.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel,Very Close to DC and to the Metro

likes.liked: — Close to DC, the Metro and very comfortable.

reviews.text: We stayed two nights, and was only charged one day fee for parking. I do not know if this is customary or not. We did ask if we could keep our vehicle in the garage the day we checked out while we went sight seeing, and we were able to.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is not only a clean, nice hotel, it's also in the perfect location. My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Arlington rather than staying in DC. We found it to be clean and easy to get to. It is on a one way street, so if you miss it, you have to go around the block and come back. Once we found (and we were doing this in dark) it was a cinch to get in. They have an underground parking garage, which was nice and very secure. You had to have a room key to get in from the outside whether you were driving in or going down via the elevator, so we felt comfortable leaving our car there. The hotel is close to a number of restaurants. For breakfast we found a great little store/restaurant about 1/2 a block away. And there is also a Starbucks close by. We found a Greenberry's coffee place not too far away too. I also highly recommend it if you're not into Starbucks. It's a little further away, but still within walking distance. For dinner one night, we at Ireland's Four Corners. Surprisingly the hotel did not have it listed as being within walking distance, but I'll bet it didn't take us 15 minutes to walk there, and it was well worth the walk. The hotel is within 1/2 a block from the metro station. The directions we received from the front desk to get to the metro were not that great but we still managed to find it very easily. We were surprised at how easy the metro was to navigate and how clean the station and the trains were. It made it very easy to get around - definitely better than driving. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel and if we have the opportunity to go back to the DC area, I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.liked: — it's location is perfect if you plan on going in DC
likes.disliked: — the elevators were a bit shakey

reviews.text: I stayed at this property for a week while visiting DC on business. I have typically found most Courtyards to be business-traveler-friendly and this hotel was no exception.
reviews.title: Good for business travelers

likes.liked: — Reliable free internet access throughout hotel; secure parking; convenience store

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not only very pleased with this CY, but also with the city of Rosslyn in general. We were visiting a friend in DC, and as usual the city hotels were very pricey. This CY was offering a 89/rate. So i really wasnt expecting it to be very nice. But upon arrival it looked clean, modern, and well equipped for most travelers needs. Our room was nothing incredible, but certainly very nice for 89/night. It was similar to the average CY as far as in-room ammenities, and appeared to be very clean.
reviews.title: Pleasant suprise...

reviews.text: The metro system is just up the road, so this is a great place to stay when DC downtown hotels are too pricey. Its only about 10 mins via metro line to the Amtrak station and downtown area. Check this place out if you are looking for a good value in the DC area. I also noticed many rests. and bars within walking distance, so you wont need to leave the area for food or entertainment.
reviews.title: okay, but pricey unless you get a deal
Not disappointed with Courtyard Arlington
reviews.text: I stayed here 3 nights for business and paid $279/night. I've stayed in a lot of Marriott Courtyards, this one being the most expensive and ranking a bit on the below average side compared to other Courtyards.

pros - the front desk staff was very friendly. Its was about 5 blocks to where I was going, and only about 3 to the Rosslyn metro station, so it was very convenient both for work and seeing a few sites in the evening. The bed was comfortable and the room was pretty standard for a Courtyard, although probably the smallest room I've had at any Courtyard.
reviews.title: A nice stay at the Courtyard Arlington

reviews.text: cons - The lobby and restaurant area for some reason smelled very strongly of chlorine from the pool, even though the pool is in an enclosed area at one end of the building. My room was across the hall from the ice machine, which I didn't think much about, but the room lacked adequate sound proofing and had a large gap under the door (over half inch). The first night at least 4 people came to get ice after midnight, waking me up each time. I put towels under the door and set the ac fan to be on all the time, which helped.
reviews.title: Arlington: It's More Than A Cemetery

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Arlington Rosslyn Hotel Arlington
